According to Joan Lombardi, investments in little kids enjoy bipartisan support, but rhetoric without resources won't get it done. #bthru8

Rep. O'Donnell: We do know there are a lot of issues, but will expanding #KanCare solve it?  Will this protect rural hospitals? #ksleg
Rep. Ward: The people of KS deserve the debate about closing the coverage gap on the floors of the House and the Senate. #KanCareForum
Sen. King: Medicaid expansion isn't a viable political option in Kansas, but saying no to everything isn't an option either. #KanCareForum

Rep. Hawkins questions value of expanding #Medicaid, but acknowledges need for solution. "We have got to do something." #KanCareForum
Closing the coverage gap and Midwestern values can go hand-in-hand. It happened in Indiana. #KanCareForum
Closing the coverage gap is a hand up and a workforce development tool in Indiana.  Plan reflects Indiana values.  #KanCareForum
According to panel, Indiana Governor sees closing coverage gap as workforce issue.  Important to EcoDevo. #KanCareForum
Indiana Governor describes closing coverage gap as hand up, not a handout. #kancareforum
Panel says closing coverage gap in Indiana wasn't endorsement of #ACA. #KanCareForum
Panel advises Kansas to acknowledge pitfalls and design a plan to get past them.  #KanCareForum
An Indiana-specific plan and a focus on personal accountability keys to successfully closing coverage gap. #KanCareForum
Listening to panel of experts from Indiana discuss the lessons learned from successfully closing their coverage gap.  #ksleg #KanCareForum
Indiana closed its coverage gap and enhanced payments to providers.  It's possible. #ksleg #KanCare
More than 200,000 new enrollees since Indiana closed its coverage gap. #ksleg #KanCare
Closing the coverage gap will ensure more kids get and keep the health coverage already available to them. #KsLeg #KanCare
Attending KanCare Forum in Wichita.  About to hear about how Indiana advanced a plan to close its coverage gap. #ksleg

Beckerman provides an overview of #CCDBG.  Says a new statewide quality rating system is coming.  No public hearing date set yet.
According to Beckerman, #CCDBG designed to provide quality child care and a work support for families, particularly low-income families.
Karen Beckerman sharing information about #CCDBG with stakeholders at childcare licensing meeting.  State plan due March 1, 2016.

DCF partnering with KDHE, sharing updates with child care stakeholders now.  Hoping to learn more about the agency's plans for #CCDBG.
KDHE preparing to get started with first conversation hosted by state agency about #CCDBG.  It's an issue that impacts all KS families.
